result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall J. Lego was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Randall J. Lego is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Randall J. Lego was found guilty of Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:19 a.m. Defendant Randall J. Lego in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes he has reviewed statements already submitted. Schiek calls K.J.; gives statement. Cirilli calls K.N.; gives statement. Cirilli calls T.N.; gives statement. Schiek notes Victim Rights compliance. Court statement. Counsel in receipt of Amended PSI. Schiek statement to sentencing; no restitution being requested. Cirilli speaks to sentencing; defendant has successfully completed AODA counseling. Lego statement. Court statement; speaks to considerations at sentencing--rehabilitation, protect public safety, deterence, and punishment/accountability. The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

Court sentence
WHS
7 yrs. POP
9 months county jail w/Huber - commence on or before 9/1/16 at 8:00 a.m.
$2,500 fine inclusive - paid to clerk of courts w/in 60 days
AODA assessment and follow-through
Continue w/mental health counseling
200 hrs. community service (allowed via Huber) --- with focus on school/younger people/broken families
DNA sample
Appeal Rights
Ineligible Voting Rights Notice forwarded to counsel
  Review hearing scheduled for September 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

1:29 p.m. Defendant Randall J. Lego in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf304, 15tr3295, 15tr3057. Schiek statement to resolution. State moves to dismiss Count 2 - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Plea questionaire filed.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty on Count 1. Schiek has complied with victim rights legislation. Court orders PSI to be completed by/before June 10, 2016. Author of PSI does not need be present. State moves to dismiss 15tr3295-Granted. State moves to deem refusal in 15tr3057 reasonable - Granted. Bail continued. Adj. 1:39 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

2:34 p.m. Defendant Randall J. Lego in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State files Information - Cirilli in receipt of Information, waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas to all counts. Bail continued. Adj. 2:37 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Response to State's Discovery Demand  - includes cover letter
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

2:40 p.m. Defendant Randall J. Lego in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf304 and 15tr3057. In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived. All citations to track with criminal case.
Bail continued. Adj. 2:42 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Allow driving only to and from work
No intoxicants; no taverns; no operation of motor vehicle while case is pending
